alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:02PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherry County through 845 PM CDT... At 801 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Merritt Reservoir, or 31 miles north of Mullen, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 97 between mile markers 88 and 115. Highway 83 between mile markers 170 and 195. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
